author: JaiGaneshCode
body:
I am trying to open a New-PSSession to ConnectionURI "https://outlook.office365.com/powershell-liveid/" from my Ubuntu or CentOS machine which is behind a proxy. 
For this command I am unable to set proxy using the PSSessionOptions and cmdlet ProxyAccessType, ProxyAuthentication and ProxyCredentials.
As my machine is behind a Proxy server and all outgoing connections must pass through the proxy machine, I get MI_RESULT_FAILED error mentioning error connecting to remote server.

Please help me out on this.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @PaulHigin Could you please comment the issue about proxy support in New-PSSession cmdlet?

comments.author: JaiGaneshCode
comments.body: Adding to the question, I tried the ProxyAccessType on Ubuntu and CentOS with powershell 6.0.4, 6.2.0 but got the error saying ProxyAccessType is not recognized in New-PSSessionOptions.

comments.author: peacand
comments.body: I'm also interested by this feature. Is there any way to make New-PSSession going through a proxy with Powershell Core on Linux ?

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: /cc @SteveL-MSFT Perhaps it is useful for Azure scenarios.

comments.author: peacand
comments.body: It is exactly for Azure scenarios that I would like to use it  ;-). To connect to Exchange Online powershell from Linux through a HTTP proxy.

comments.author: PaulHigin
comments.body:
"I get MI_RESULT_FAILED error mentioning error connecting to remote server."

It looks like WinRM/OMI implementation does not support proxies.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Since OMI is no longer being developed and needed for non-Windows WSMan support, it's unlikely we'll get proxy support for non-Windows.

comments.author: peacand
comments.body:
For those who might need to use New-PSSession on Linux through a HTTP proxy, you can use the project Proxychains which hooks transparently TCP connection from any binary through a SOCKS or HTTP proxy. I tested with pwsh, it works well :-) [https://github.com/haad/proxychains](https://github.com/haad/proxychains)
GitHub
haad/proxychains
proxychains - a tool that forces any TCP connection made by any given application to follow through proxy like TOR or any other SOCKS4, SOCKS5 or HTTP(S) proxy. Supported auth-types: "user/pa...

comments.author: spKhan00
comments.body: @JaiGaneshCode  Is this issue fixed?? I am having the same problem.

title: Proxy support for Non Windows Powershell
